str2: A particle of succession, then, moreover.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A basin for washing hands or feet. From nipto; a ewer.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To wash; mid. I wash my own (hands, etc.). To cleanse; ceremonially, to perform ablution.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
To wipe, wipe (off) thoroughly. From ek and the base of massaomai; to knead out, i.e. to wipe dry.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A towel, apron, coarse cloth. Of Latin origin; a 'linen' cloth, i.e. Apron.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To gird, tie around; mid: I gird round myself. From dia and zonnumi; to gird tightly.
